comment.author: 7471115@N08
comment._content: The ship in the background appears to be the armored cruiser USS New York. Nice shot of the Brooklyn! Hope to see more naval/nautical-themed photos in your collection posted.

comment.author: 43551348@N03
comment._content: My grandfather served on the USS Brooklynn during WW1 and was deployed to Vladivostok, USSR. I have several photo/postcards of the ship and men during his deployment. If there is any interest , I will get some decent scans and upload them.

comment.author: 7471115@N08
comment._content: DavelnTx: It would be great if you could upload those images on Flickr; I'm sure they'd be of interest to the Naval History group: www.flickr.com/groups/navalhistory/ The Brooklyn, in my opinion, was one of the coolest-looking US naval vessels ever. Too bad she wasn't preserved like (or instead of!) the Olympia...

comment.author: 35551608@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/43551348@N03]   dave;

  I am very much interested in any pics of the Brooklyn in WWI, the Vladivostok  period was a nearly forgotten end of WWI incident with the arch angel port and the US and others trying to support the Czar in there Revolution.  I would like to see any pictures of the Brooklyn especially.
